ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Incredibly helpful guiding framework for writing your thesis.
Writing my thesis was a massive learning experience. I learned how to conduct real research on different databases. Most importantly, I learned how to narrow down a research question.
In the completion of our senior essays we developed our research skills, writing skills, and presentation skills.

In this class, I was able to conduct formal research for my thesis focused on the environmental justice and sustainable development considerations of plastic waste in a postcolonial context. I gained insight into IRB and processes, and I expanded my knowledge of environmental justice.
I am learning how to conduct my own research project!
This course guided me through the senior essay writing process by providing clear structure and weekly assignments.
Wrote my senior thesis

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Can't be improved. This rocked.

I think the EVST major does thesis prep much better than other majors. I really liked having a mentor group to lean on and ask questions too. I also appreciate the assignments we had due each week which kept me on track compared my friends in different majors who saved all their work until the end of the semester. Finally, I really liked the thesis presentations I thought that was super rewarding.

While I wouldn't have appreciated it at the time, with hindsight, I think there should be one earlier deadline for a partial draft prior to the Nov. 19th rough draft deadline. I think this would be helpful because, at least for me, my thesis work seemed to really escalate at this point of the semester. 
This course was super helpful for helping me stay on track with my senior essay and I really appreciated the feedback I received from my colloquium mentor and my peers. It was also really cool getting to learn about the work everyone was doing in small groups.

I think that the small mentor groups were incredibly helpful in getting feedback and support in my writing process. I appreciated having the drafts due early and having the time to review/ make edits. No major weaknesses I can think of.
This course is very well organized to facilitate student research and productivity. I only wish there were more opportunities to submit concrete pages of writing, rather than planning/data.

From talking to students in other majors I am very thankful for this colloquium as I don't think students compiling their thesis in other majors were offered as much support and clarity which I was provided with.

Strengths: the group dynamic of working on the thesis in a small group was helpful, and the peer and professor check-ins were really helpful, especially compared to friends writing research projects in less structured programs. 
Weaknesses: Given the desire for people to conduct independent research, the major needs to give students tools their junior year to conduct research over the summer - possibly with an entire seminar, or with a series of evening workshops.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yep! Pretty sure you have to take it, though.
Yes, because we all have to take it. But in all seriousness, it's actually very helpful! And at times even fun.
I would definitely recommend it to others because it was helpful and a great experience (but keep in mind it's also the senior requirement for EVST, so you likely don't have much of a choice...).
This is a required course for my fellow EVST majors. It's definitely well-structured to help you get through the thesis!
This is required for the EVST major. However, it is a pretty fun and relaxed environment to write your thesis in!
Yes. From my understanding, it is required for the senior essay and helps to provide structure to the semester.
